intro: Aspicarpa pentandra subsp. arnottiana, commonly known as the narrow-leaf aspicarpa, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, often branched stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically narrow and elliptical in shape. Its flowers are usually clustered in small inflorescences and are often pale green or white in color. This subspecies is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
